page.title: 06St.Rumon's cottage
page.content: There are many cottages in the area which are similar to this one.It is about 200 years old.The walls are two feet thick and are made of cob.It used to have a thatched roof and before the extension six people lived in only two small rooms.The ceiling has beams and floorboards.There is an inglenook fireplace where an old cornish range used to be.In our garden there are the remains of another cottage in which the postman lived.People thought he was eccentric because he wore a long,black cloak.On the deeds of our cottage,the remains of the postman's cottage and our neighbour's house,which used to be a priory,were all called Goblin's Corner!It is believed the cottage gets its name and the area it is in,St.Ruan,from the time of the old Irish Saints.
